CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper March 30, 1957, pg. 1, reads: "$ue [sue] for Damage$ - Betty Jean Gilliam (left) and Ernestine Hollis, of Hazelwood, await an out-of-court settlement for injuries inflicted on them on Oct. 7, 1954, by the runaway car of George A. King, of Genesta St., which also killed John Minadeo, a young school guard. With the aid of modern medicine and her indomitable will, Miss Gilliam has made a miraculous recovery from the extremely serious injury suffered at Second and Hazlewood [sic] Aves. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Betty Jean Gilliam and Ernestine Hollis posed in interior with leaf patterned wallpaper
